incidents.name: We are experiencing elevated error rates due to Google Service Outage

incident_updates.body: All systems are working again. The impact of the Google outage will be investigated and anything remaining will be mitigated by our team. Thank you for your patience!

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incident_updates.body: We’re seeing signs of recovery across our services following the Google Cloud outage. Some functionality has been restored, but we are still observing intermittent errors. Our team is actively working to ensure a smooth and complete recovery. We’ll continue to provide updates as we make progress.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incident_updates.body: Google engineers have identified the root cause and have applied appropriate mitigations. They are still working on resolving the issue, and our engineers are actively monitoring the situation.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incident_updates.body:
We have identified that the recent increase in error rates is directly related to an ongoing outage with Google's services. Our investigation confirms that the root cause of these elevated errors stems from disruptions within Google's cloud infrastructure.

Our teams are closely monitoring the situation. We understand the impact this has on your operations and appreciate your patience as this issue is being addressed. We will provide further updates as more information becomes available or when service is fully restored.

Thank you for your understanding.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incident_updates.body: We're experiencing an elevated level of errors and are currently looking into the issue. This may cause builds not to start.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incidents.name: Users might experience issues with Gradle builds with build cache enabled

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We made a change in the Activate Bitrise Build Cache for Gradle step, and in the Bitrise Build Cache CLI, and re-enabled the Bitrise Build Cache for Gradle plugins. We're monitoring the system.

Due to Sonatype/MavenCentral rate limiting, we temporarily disabled Bitrise Build Cache for Gradle plugins to prevent failing builds.
We're working on a fix to avoid the rate-limiting issue.

We have identified that builds with Gradle cache or Gradle analytics enabled (either manually or via the Bitrise step) are affected. Any other Android/Gradle builds are not affected. Thank you for your continued patience!
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Experiencing elevated queue times on Linux

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incident_updates.body: We are currently investigating this issue.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incidents.name: Permission issues with Github App Integration

incident_updates.body: We observed elevated error rates with GitHub integration through the Bitrise GitHub App. Status reporting and build starting were impacted. The issue is resolved now.

incidents.name: A large number of builds are not starting

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are currently experiencing elevated errors in build triggering for projects connected to a GitHub repository, due to degraded performance of the GitHub API. Our team is monitoring the situation and will provide updates as soon as more information becomes available

We see elevated error rates in build triggering.

This seems to be connected to Github, especially builds requiring Github API to trigger.

We are investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Elevated Error Rate On Deploy to Bitrise Step

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We're experiencing elevated error rates with the Deploy to Bitrise Step

incidents.name: Bitrise API High Error Rate

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We're currently experiencing issues with the dashboard, build list page, and build details page loading.

incidents.name: Pipelines with Parallel Workflows Missing some Env Vars

incident_updates.body:
For the previous 4 hours, pipelines with parallel workflows didn't have the environment variables defined on the 'base' workflow.

The problematic change has been rolled back, and this should be working as intended again.


Edit with clarification:
Only env vars with non-string values were missing

incidents.name: Elevated queues in the background processing

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We see elevated queues in the background processing. We are still investigating.

incidents.name: Build queue issue causing builds to get stuck and abort

incident_updates.body: We identified an issue in our build queuing system that caused a small number of builds to get stuck in the past day and automatically abort after 60 minutes with the message “Idle Build: Build hasn’t been started or updated since more than 60 minutes ago”. The root cause has been identified and fixed.

incidents.name: We're experiencing an increased error rate with getting details about pipelines

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Hanging Linux builds

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incident_updates.body: A new Linux stack update was deployed with a kernel upgrade that should address this. We believe this is the root cause of the hanging builds, and affected projects should run test builds on the latest stack version. Let us know if you have feedback or further problems at support@bitrise.io.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incident_updates.body: A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incident_updates.body:
We are still collecting data, but this issue only affects a small percentage of users.
We are also planning fixes and are working on confirming them.

In the meantime, if you experience this issue you can roll back the stack you are using: https://devcenter.bitrise.io/en/infrastructure/build-stacks/stack-update-policy.html#using-the-previous-version-of-a-stack

In case the rollback channel doesn’t solve the issue, please reach out us and we'll take a closer look.

incidents.name: API errors in iOS codesigning-related workflows

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We see that some Apple developer accounts are affected, while the same API calls are working for other accounts. Currently we do not have a solution or workaround, but we are monitoring the issue.
We are continuing to investigate this issue.
We are investigating App Store Connect API errors thrown in workflows that fetch code-signing assets during the build.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

incidents.name: Issues with uploading build artifacts

incident_updates.body: Some users may have experienced issues with build artifact uploads.

incidents.name: Unexpected level of error rate and error count on trigger_build endpoint

incident_updates.body: This was a brief issue that has already been resolved

incidents.name: Issues with KV cache

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating issues with KV cache which is impacting build speeds

incidents.name: Potential issues with KV cache

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
One of our third party providers (Cloudflare) is experiencing issues, potentially causing KV cache save/restore steps to fail, impacting builds speeds.

incidents.name: Github services are down

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We are aware that the 3rd party service Github is currently down. We are currently waiting for a resolution. Impacted are Builds using the Build Cache which will be slower as the Build Cache CLI cannot be downloaded. Builds downloading artifacts from Github (including for example Android builds) may also fail

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating reports of errors when trying to update the stack in the workflow editor settings.

incidents.name: Issues with Nested Virtualization on Linux Builds

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

affected_components.name: Build Processing - Linux Stack (Android, web projects, ...)

incident_updates.body: We have identified degraded performance with nested virtualization for a subset of Linux builds. We're in progress with an investigation and a fix.

incidents.name: No Healthy Upstream Issues on Bitrise

incident_updates.body: We've experienced elevated error rates on Bitrise, but the issue has already been resolved.

incidents.name: Issue with Gradle Analytics

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

We're seeing unauthenticated errors in Gradle builds using the Build Cache/analytics – resulting in builds not registering their Build Cache usage.

Users using the Build Cache will not see their performance results.

incidents.name: Increased build times and timeouts

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Increased build times and timeouts

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Some users may experience increased build times. We are currently investigating and will provide an update soon.

incidents.name: Builds logs unable to generate

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating builds logs not loading

incidents.name: Build triggering via comments failing for non-GitHub setups

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Workflow Editor loading issues

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
We are aware of elevated errors on the workflow editor.

incidents.name: Apple ID Connection Errors

incident_updates.body: If you're experiencing issues with your Apple ID connection, please remove the account and reconnect using your credentials and make sure you use the latest version of the following steps: xcode-archive , export-xcarchive, xcode-build-for-test, manage-ios-code-signing.
Apple has eliminated support for an undocumented API that the community relied on heavily, causing issues with the Apple Dev Portal API. Our team is working on a resolution with the highest priority.
Identified - We're experiencing errors with the Apple Dev Portal API. While we await Apple's acknowledgment and fix, we are actively exploring potential workarounds.

incidents.name: Elevated queue times for M1 4core and M1 8core machine types

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
We are currently investigating this issue.

incidents.name: Cannot add new step in Workflow Editor

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
Users trying to add a new step in their Workflow Editor could be met with an empty workflow, unable to be edited, our engineers are currently looking at this issue.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.
A fix has been implemented and we are monitoring the results.
When reaching Bitrise.io, users can be met with a "no healthy upstream" error. We are investigating the issue.

We've noticed a slight increase in upload/download times for the key-value cache on Mac stacks. Our team is currently investigating the issue.

incidents.name: Some customers may experience issues with subscribing to our "Hobby"plan

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Some customers have reported experiencing issues subscribing to our "Hobby" plan. Our Website team is currently looking into this. We will send updates as soon as possible and we apologize for the inconvenience this may cause.

incidents.name: High Gradle Analytics error rate

incident_updates.body: Invocations done in the timeframe 8:40 CET -> 11:00 CET were unfortunately not saved, so for these builds, customers won't see their invocation details, but for newer builds everything is working good again, and the issue is resolved.

Some users can experience that Gradle analytics has stopped working for them, they can see "No cache usage" on their gradle / android builds.

Our engineers are currently looking into this.

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

The issue has been identified and a fix is being implemented.
We've received notifications of an unreachable iOS mobile config, we are unsure of how many users are affected, but we are investigating.

incidents.name: Some server nodes in ATL are experiencing outage

incident_updates.body: This incident has been resolved.

Some ATL nodes in are unresponsive, which also impacts Build Cache. Our engineers are investigating the issue.
